sub_topic: Solving systems of nonlinear equations using Newton's method
message_1:
Consider the system of two equations:

x^2 - y + e^x = 0

xsin(y) + y^2 - 1 = 0

Use Newton's method to approximate the solutions (x,y) to this system to the precision of 10^-4 with the initial guess (1,1).
message_2:
To apply Newton's method to this system of equations, we first need to compute the Jacobian matrix of the system, which consists of the partial derivatives of the functions with respect to x and y:

J(x, y) = | ∂f1/∂x  ∂f1/∂y |
          | ∂f2/∂x  ∂f2/∂y |

where f1(x, y) = x^2 - y + e^x and f2(x, y) = xsin(y) + y^2 - 1.

Computing the partial derivatives, we get:

∂f1/∂x = 2x + e^x
∂f1/∂y = -1
∂f2/∂x = sin(y)
∂f2/∂y = xcos(y) + 2y

So the Jacobian matrix is:

J(x, y) = | 2x + e^x  -1  |
          | sin(y)   xcos(y) + 2y |

Now, we apply Newton's method iteratively using the formula:

(x, y) = (x, y) - J(x, y)^(-1) * F(x, y)

where F(x, y) = (f1(x, y), f2(x, y)) and J(x, y)^(-1) is the inverse of the Jacobian matrix.

We start with the initial guess (x, y) = (1, 1) and iterate until the difference between consecutive approximations is less than 10^(-4).

Iteration 1:
(x, y) = (1, 1)
J(x, y) = | 3  -1  |
          | 0   3  |
F(x, y) = (1, 0)
J(x, y)^(-1) = | 1/3  1/3 |
               | 0    1/3 |
J(x, y)^(-1) * F(x, y) = (1/3, 0)
(x, y) = (1, 1) - (1/3, 0) = (2/3, 1)

Iteration 2:
(x, y) = (2/3, 1)
J(x, y) ≈ | 2.718  -1     |
          | 0.841  2.155  |
F(x, y) ≈ (-0.037, 0.111)
J(x, y)^(-1) ≈ | 0.372  0.172 |
               |-0.182  0.589 |
J(x, y)^(-1) * F(x, y) ≈ (-0.010, 0.079)
(x, y) = (2/3, 1) - (-0.010, 0.079) ≈ (0.676, 0.921)

Iteration 3:
(x, y) = (0.676, 0.921)
J(x, y) ≈ | 2.933  -1     |
          | 0.798  1.841  |
F(x, y) ≈ (-0.0004, 0.002)
J(x, y)^(-1) ≈ | 0.318  0.173 |
               |-0.138  0.507 |
J(x, y)^(-1) * F(x, y) ≈ (-0.0006, 0.001)
(x, y) = (0.676, 0.921) - (-0.0006, 0.001) ≈ (0.677, 0.920)

At this point, the difference between consecutive approximations is less than 10^(-4), so we can stop the iterations.

The approximate solution to the system of equations using Newton's method with the initial guess (1, 1) and a precision of 10^(-4) is (x, y) ≈ (0.677, 0.920).
